Text:
Central New York and the nation are facing the worst healthcare staffing shortage in recent memory. My bipartisan bill would incentivize retired healthcare professionals to help alleviate this crisis.
https://t.co/KzAHYR90A4

Every person and institution is vulnerable to cyberattacks. As Russia becomes more belligerent in its aggressions against Ukraine, we could also see attacks against our nation. I joined @ABCGMA3 to discuss this growing threat. https://t.co/946GGY69nu

Saddened to learn of the passing of my friend and colleague Congressman Jim Hagedorn. Jim was a fighter and lifelong public servant who cherished the opportunity to serve his constituents in Southern Minnesota. He will be dearly missed in the Halls of Congress.
To help alleviate the staffing shortage at local hospitals, I have reintroduced the Health Care Worker and First Responder Social Security Beneficiary Choice Act. https://t.co/xCUMvhm9tM

I was proud to introduce the Countering Human Trafficking Act. This bipartisan bill brings us one step closer to ending human trafficking by enhancing @DHSgov’s Center for Combatting Human Trafficking and expanding national public awareness programs.  https://t.co/lv9Z5gEGoq
While most Central New Yorkers are glad the snow is finally clearing, I know dogs like mine aren’t very happy… https://t.co/cyLSHbymYU

ICYMI: I penned an op-ed published by @thehill regarding China’s leveraging of the 2022 Beijing Olympics to obscure its flagrant human rights violations, anti-democratic actions, and military and economic aggressions. https://t.co/5MXhNTE8uD

I earned a 100% on the @HSLegFund Scorecard for my work to promote animal welfare. Throughout my time in Congress, I’ve proudly championed commonsense policies to protect animals from cruelty and abuse. https://t.co/TafgeZdwO3

Out of control spending has contributed to the highest inflation rate in 40 years. My Informed Lawmaking to Combat Inflation Act would address this troubling trend by requiring lawmakers in Congress to fully consider the inflationary impact of major bills. https://t.co/aSHZ4zsEP2
I spoke on the House Floor in support of law enforcement. I will always have their back, and they will forever have my thanks and admiration. https://t.co/a3XGUNRDj4

I joined @MorningsMaria to discuss Russia’s military buildup along the Ukrainian border. Bad actors like Russia will exploit weakness whenever they can. The Biden Administration must stand up to Vladimir Putin. https://t.co/W8uMfgZEdI

With inflation at a 40-year high, I introduced the Informed Lawmaking to Combat Inflation Act. This bill will require lawmakers in Congress to thoroughly consider the inflationary impact of significant bills before they come up for a vote. https://t.co/6PN00s9iYO

The @FAANews briefly banned certain low-visibility landings at @SyracuseAirport last month over concerns the anticipated rollout of 5G technology would interfere with aircraft instruments. Today, during a @TransportGOP hearing, I questioned FAA officials about this incident. https://t.co/20myotAR1C

I introduced a resolution to raise awareness for National Human Trafficking and Modern Slavery Prevention Month and supported a bipartisan bill to fund human trafficking awareness trainings for law enforcement agencies across the country. https://t.co/Ec3jUkGY7X
Happy Groundhog Day! Not surprising to everyone here in CNY, Punxsutawney Phil saw his shadow. 6 more weeks of winter. https://t.co/1cGJuHeOka

ICYMI: I joined @EveningEdit to discuss the unacceptable attacks on our law enforcement community following the tragic loss of @NYPDnews Officer Jason Rivera and his partner, Officer Wilbert Mora https://t.co/djcIzntD3t
I introduced the Neighborhood Reinvestment and Revitalization Act, which will provide federal funding to renovate or demolish abandoned and dilapidated properties. https://t.co/P0ra1x4A1V

Today, on International Holocaust Remembrance Day, we honor the lives of the more than 6 million Jews killed by the Nazi regime. This day ensures we never forget this tragic chapter in human history. https://t.co/hYyU9J3eU3
Albany’s bail reform law has made New York less safe. That’s why I’m calling on state leaders to address this failed measure and prioritize the safety of New Yorkers. https://t.co/Ryitt8qLvy
Very cold week here in CNY. Be sure to let your pets in, but maybe throw a ball with them first! https://t.co/KpEK92dhFY

One of my greatest joys in Congress has been working with @HonorFlightSYR to honor local veterans on their birthdays. Join me in congratulating World War II veteran Wallace Roher for becoming CNY’s newest centenarian! https://t.co/7ZvxrINPSs
I led members of the Republican New York State Congressional Delegation in urging @GovKathyHochul to rein in dangerous bail reform laws & prioritize public safety. https://t.co/Y22hK0GbeG

I applaud the @USACEHQ for utilizing $10.3 million in federal funding from the Bipartisan Physical Infrastructure Law to jumpstart deepening efforts in Oswego Harbor and make essential repairs to the Little Sodus West Pier in Fair Haven. https://t.co/DvBQfZFMHB

As new COVID-19 variants emerge and cases rise, I’m urging President Biden to look to local medical centers like @UpstateNews for guidance and technology that can improve our nation’s public health response and testing strategy. https://t.co/0iYICEb75I

I was glad to join the @ACEC_National to discuss how the Bipartisan Physical Infrastructure Law will make meaningful and long overdue investments in Central New York’s infrastructure. Listen below! https://t.co/Yq8KKenpZy

Today, we celebrate and remember the legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. This day represents a moment to remember Dr. King’s outstanding commitment to equality, justice, and love for one another. https://t.co/Kbw9Nmavk4

I introduced legislation to reauthorize & update the COPS grant program. This program ensures police departments of all sizes in CNY receive funding to bolster training, purchase lifesaving protective equipment, & expand community policing initiatives. https://t.co/xUYyGgYlc1
Thank you all for the well-wishes this week. I’m feeling much better and Henry has kept me company as I recover! https://t.co/3RgU72bl6j

I am very pleased to announce the Central New York Regional Planning and Development Board has received $70,000 from the @US_EDA to support projects that spur job growth and economic development in Central New York. https://t.co/kw0jmbf13O

Skyrocketing inflation is threatening the job market and forcing working families to pay more at the grocery store and gas pump. This is not business as usual. It’s time the Biden administration stop pushing reckless spending policies. 
https://t.co/iLT7zrIxuB

I tested positive for COVID-19 yesterday. I am fully vaccinated and boosted, and am thankfully experiencing only mild symptoms. I will be voting by proxy in Washington this week and working from home as I recover. My constituent service team remains available and ready to serve.

For more than 20 months, @SocialSecurity field offices  have been closed, leaving many Central New Yorkers unable to access Social Security services. I’m urging SSA to provide a timeline for safely reopening its field offices.
https://t.co/0cqK9FPxxc
My statement on the one-year anniversary of the January 6, 2021 attack on U.S. Capitol: https://t.co/JdbphJF5By

I’m pleased to announce $5.4 million in federal funding from the bipartisan physical Infrastructure law will be delivered to @SyracuseAirport and Oswego County Airport for improvements to airport infrastructure! https://t.co/PqRjRUGOF5
Happy New Year! I remain incredibly thankful to serve Central New York, and I am excited to see what 2022 brings! https://t.co/M5ADJfc4el
Wishing all of Central New York a Merry Christmas! I hope your day is filled with joy and spent with family and friends! https://t.co/6YvuXCSq6a

I was honored to assist Mr. William Gabak, an Auburn resident and US Navy veteran, in acquiring the Armed Forces Expeditionary Medal that was due to him. I had the opportunity to present it to him in a ceremony this week. https://t.co/taZObTALse

I joined @FoxBusiness to discuss the consequences of reckless bail reform policies, the ‘Defund the Police’ movement, and rising crime in communities across the country. Watch below. https://t.co/xLcFzODBfk
With @NewsChannel9 Anchor Dan Cummings set to retire today, I spoke on the House Floor to honor his remarkable career. https://t.co/p3sxyfqm1X

Legislation I supported to award the Congressional Gold Medal to the 13 servicemembers who lost their lives in August during the evacuation from Afghanistan was signed into law this week. I’m proud to be honoring the sacrifice of these heroes.https://t.co/bIRbUJUsai

I joined @MorningsMaria from the southern border to discuss how Biden’s open border policies have emboldened drug traffickers and allowed drugs to pour into communities like ours. Every state is now a border state. https://t.co/UteyBVqBh5

If Democrats were serious about combating the opioid epidemic, they would focus on securing our southern border to reduce the flow of illicit drugs and take responsible steps to expand access to treatment options. https://t.co/DJFW8O0jmi

Measures I authored in this bill will address risks within our supply chain and strengthen the cybersecurity of our critical infrastructure systems.
https://t.co/IgbtrCTxXO
Rod was a fixture on televisions in Central New York for five decades and will be remembered as one of the most trusted and reliable sources of news. May he rest in peace. https://t.co/3kNUfwMbHJ
I’m joining the @NewsChannel9 team and our Central New York community in mourning the loss of legendary news anchor Rod Wood. https://t.co/3kNUfwMbHJ

I am pleased to support the continued partnership between the @SyracuseAirport and @174thAttackWing.
https://t.co/FGodAbRTjL

This week, I paid my respects to the late Senator Bob Dole as he lay in state at the U.S. Capitol. Senator Dole was a hero of World War II, titan of the U.S. Senate, and true statesman. My wife, Robin, and I wish the Dole family peace during this difficult time. https://t.co/b1GwnINTvv

With this fix, seniors will now be reimbursed through Medicare for mental healthcare they receive over the phone. I’m proud to have fought for this vital change. 
https://t.co/FaUr5Ml58K

I proudly cast my vote in favor of the NDAA. This measure includes key federal funding to support manufacturers & workers in CNY. Importantly, it also includes a bill I drafted to identify and address areas of concern within our nation’s supply chain. https://t.co/nR6lAJmMd9

China is a threat to American security and has a dismal record on human rights. A diplomatic boycott of the Olympics in Beijing falls short of the action needed to hold China accountable. 
https://t.co/WN9wbEAWRG

I joined @ABCGMA3 to discuss the rise of violent crime across the country and why I believe a  boycott of the 2022 Beijing Olympics is necessary amid China’s growing military aggressions and human rights abuses. Watch below. https://t.co/CapNAOJOik

80 years ago today, the US base at Pearl Harbor was attacked. 2,403 American lives were lost on this day. We will never forget those brave servicemembers or the courageous men and women who answered the call in the wake of this attack to defend our freedom and democracy. https://t.co/npBeRWCxuj

My statement on the Biden Administration's announcement of a diplomatic boycott of the Beijing 2022 Winter Olympics:
https://t.co/lxcN020b93
ICYMI: I penned an op-ed published by @FoxNews regarding China’s exploitation of US academic institutions to make technological and military advances. https://t.co/yXuWtlvE9G

After urging the @CMSGov to change their policy, I am pleased to announce Medicare will now allow CNY seniors to be reimbursed for mental health services they receive over the phone. https://t.co/PQPxkE7Uac

Today, in recognition of the International Day of Persons with Disabilities, I join our international community in affirming our shared commitment to empowering individuals with disabilities. https://t.co/lSOvGp29HR

The supply chain crisis is causing higher prices & shortages. That’s why I’m working to address this crisis by delivering investments to build up the American manufacturing sector. https://t.co/S0R2GUzpwN

I was excited to tour the facilities at SRCTec and present employees with a submission to the Congressional Record honoring the company’s 15th anniversary. We are incredibly happy to have this innovative company call Central New York home! https://t.co/XjLi5Ii5ji

I introduced a bipartisan, bicameral bill to protect access to clean water in Central New York. This bill authorizes $50 million in @EPA grants to develop and deploy smart water technology to help improve water quality. https://t.co/MSK7lnEOiS

Our nation is vulnerable when we rely on China for critical goods. We must take steps to bring manufacturing back to the US and work on bolstering our domestic supply chain.             https://t.co/gLdGfaON8C

I joined @SundayFutures to talk about the crisis at our southern border. Overdoses in CNY are skyrocketing as dangerous drugs continue to pour across the border. Every single community in our nation is affected by this crisis and we need to secure our borders. https://t.co/EgvD5nNI9I

We need to focus on bolstering American manufacturing to address the supply chain crisis, promote supply chain security, and create good-paying jobs in Central New York.(3/3)
https://t.co/KqTp8BMta8

It’s clear our nation has become over reliant on China, and it’s having an impact on our local manufacturing sector. (2/3)
https://t.co/KqTp8BMta8

I hosted a roundtable discussion on the supply chain crisis with representatives from Morse, Manufacturing @MACNY_MfgAssoc, @CenterStateCEO, @NucorCorp, @MohawkGlobal, and @HillromCorp. (1/3)
https://t.co/KqTp8BMta8
Happy Hanukkah to all those celebrating in Central New York! I hope the holiday brings you much peace & joy. https://t.co/aOqkVS1znT
From my family, to yours, have a happy and safe Thanksgiving! https://t.co/s7KAi5clcX

Wayne Mahar has been a fixture in weather forecasting in Central New York for 36 years. As Wayne prepares to retire, I was glad to celebrate with him at @CNYCentral and present him with the remarks I submitted to the Congressional Record honoring his distinguished career. https://t.co/RyBwRBmtpY

The bipartisan physical infrastructure bill will overhaul our infrastructure systems with American steel produced by companies like Nucor in Auburn and our construction industry. Grateful for the support of CNY workers for this measure. https://t.co/HqdFEW1V5q

Radical calls to defund the police and reckless bail reform laws like the ones on the books in New York State have devastating consequences. I discussed these issues and the need to take deliberate steps to address the rising rates of violent crime on @EveningEdit. https://t.co/YeycuYFvcS
I was proud to present @LeMoyne College President Linda LeMura with remarks I submitted to the Congressional Record honoring the College’s 75th anniversary. 🐬🐬🐬 https://t.co/MhKFnATGyV

I joined my Republican colleagues in voting ‘no’ on the reckless Build Back Better Act, which would balloon our national debt, and implement radical Green New Deal policies.
https://t.co/pYPXRcNOGs

At nearly $2 trillion, the Build Back Better Act authorizes one of the largest expansions of the federal government in US history. It is completely irresponsible and ignores vital issues like rising inflation.
https://t.co/UFG4FQqq7v

I joined @IdemiaGroup and the @SyracuseAirport to say thank you to our local Transportation Security Officers and to honor @TSA’s 20th anniversary. These officers are on the frontline lines every day working to keep our airports, airspace, and nation safe. https://t.co/jJSfHRio1e

I joined the bipartisan @ProbSolveCaucus to urge Congress to fully fund the CHIPS for America Act. Doing so could jumpstart semiconductor manufacturing in Central New York by delivering investments to build new domestic manufacturing facilities. https://t.co/gtEXgPzDO4

I voted ‘no’ on the House Democrats’ multi-trillion-dollar socialist spending spree. My full statement:
https://t.co/IVQKfu3jDY
100% of the bipartisan infrastructure bill will be used to fund long overdue upgrades to physical infrastructure systems in Central New York and across the country. https://t.co/g4Cv3CkLg1

On the steps of the U.S. Capitol, I joined @HouseGOP to express our firm opposition to the Build Back Better Act. The reckless spending and Green New Deal provisions in this bill are completely unsustainable and will place an undue tax burden on our nation. https://t.co/DSIJ4lMVAS
With Wayne Mahar set to retire in December after 36 years of weather forecasting with @CNYCentral, I spoke on House Floor to honor his remarkable career. https://t.co/VQSuV5RgTo

According to the @USCBO, the bipartisan infrastructure bill will have a 33% return on investment because of the long-term economic benefits of upgrading roads, bridges, water systems, and other hard infrastructure projects. This bill is a win for CNY.
https://t.co/3OnAGSvcR2

The bipartisan physical infrastructure bill is going to revitalize Central New York’s roads, bridges, water systems, and more. This targeted and responsible investment will create jobs and spur massive economic benefits in our communities. https://t.co/xbYSTRQM3d

I was excited to join @SouthwestAir for its first flight out of @SyracuseAirport! The Syracuse Airport is a significant economic engine for our region. With the addition of Southwest Airlines, I am eager to see the new opportunities that will be created. https://t.co/Vv0vv1L3wO
ICYMI: I penned the following op-ed published in The Post-Standard highlighting wins for Central New York in the bipartisan physical infrastructure bill. https://t.co/GhxA9rZ9uH

I joined local elected officials and infrastructure stakeholders from across New York’s 24th Congressional District to highlight the important local wins contained in the physical infrastructure bill, which recently passed in Congress.
https://t.co/JldkE84NNI

On Veterans Day, I visited with veterans residing at Camillus Ridge Terrace and presented them with Congressional Certificates honoring their courageous service to our nation. It was wonderful meeting these veterans and hearing stories about their days in the Armed Forces. https://t.co/fmlDgdkRuY
Today we honor those who have bravely fought for our freedom and democracy. We owe our nation’s veterans and their families a tremendous debt of gratitude. #ThankYouVeterans https://t.co/KWkke7WD5j

Over the weekend, families from across Central New York came out to celebrate local veterans at the New York State Fairgrounds! Our region is home to thousands of veterans and we are proud to celebrate them this week! https://t.co/NYmDf2aA4I

Last week, the @IVMFSyracuseU officially dedicated the National Veteran’s Resource Center in honor of  Syracuse University Graduate and U.S. Navy veteran Daniel D’Aniello and his wife, Gayle. https://t.co/pL1jtLJv7b
This week is National School Psychology Week. I’m joining the @nasponline in saying thank you to all the incredible psychology professionals working in schools nationwide! https://t.co/uEEnhGSg9S
My statement on tonight's votes in the House. https://t.co/T6deqceSpS

Last night, the House passed the Preliminary Damage Assessment (PDA) Improvement Act, a bipartisan bill I introduced to enhance @fema’s processes for delivering timely and reliable relief for disaster-impacted communities. https://t.co/E8qmQ8bqHx

Sadly, many Americans, including hundreds of 9/11 first responders, are still suffering from this terrible disease. This bill creates a national patient registry to collect voluntary data from mesothelioma patients so we can understand, treat, and eventually find a cure. (2/2)

I am proud to reintroduce the Mary Jo Lawyer Spano Mesothelioma Patient Registry Act of 2021, a bill inspired by a Central New York native who lost her battle with mesothelioma in 2014. (1/2) https://t.co/0NFcedu2vw

We've seen Albany's bail reform laws act as a revolving door for violent repeat offenders. And yet, Washington Democrats want to bring these policies to the federal level. My bill pushes back. https://t.co/2ogXIoOAXI

I spoke in opposition of the Democrats’ multi-trillion dollar spending package. Despite its huge price tag, this bill ignores the many security crises facing our nation and excludes funding for border security and counterterrorism. I will vote ‘no’. https://t.co/nLa8CBOUpG

I’m wearing teal in recognition of the @alzfdn’s Light the World in Teal Day. Currently, of the top 10 leading causes of death, Alzheimer’s is the only one that cannot be prevented or cured with medicine. It’s time we change that. https://t.co/gWdIIqoAUe

Speaker Pelosi & the far-left want to vote on the Build Back Better Act without an accurate accounting of how much this measure will cost taxpayers. I joined @HouseGOP in calling for the nonpartisan @USCBO to publish a full cost estimate BEFORE Congress votes on this bill.

Albany’s bail reform has contributed to far too many tragedies. My bill, the SERVE Our Communities Act, is aimed at incentivizing New York State to adopt sensible policies that help keep violent, repeat offenders behind bars. https://t.co/A4MnB3qefl

With the SERVE Our Communities Act, I’m aiming to provide a strong incentive for New York State to adopt sensible policies that support law enforcement and provide prosecutors with the necessary tools to keep violent criminals behind bars. https://t.co/gRZdLd0cJe

At the @Onondaga_Co_DA office, I joined local law enforcement, the family of Connie Tuori, and members of the New York State Legislature to announce the Stop Enabling Repeat Violence and Endangering (SERVE) Our Communities Act. https://t.co/gRZdLd0cJe
Wishing all in Central New York a safe & happy Halloween! 🎃👻 https://t.co/HppxYfNKBr

I was honored to present retired Col. Lawrence Myers with a flag flown over the US Capitol Building in celebration of his 100th birthday. Col. Myers is an exemplary patriot who served in WWII and spent several decades in the Army. Happy birthday! https://t.co/ROnlGSn1BF

In CNY, we are fortunate to have organizations like @VeraHouseInc, @ywcasyracuse, Cayuga Counseling Services, @OCOtweetspot, and the Victim Resource Center of the Finger Lakes working to end domestic violence. I’m proud to partner with these organizations on the federal level.
I signed on to a bipartisan Congressional Resolution recognizing October as Domestic Violence Awareness Month. https://t.co/a4lVHxvfMz

The semiconductor shortage is stunting economic growth, hurting workers, and providing foreign competitors with opportunities to further disrupt our supply chain. That’s why I'm pushing for Congress to fully fund the CHIPS for America Act. https://t.co/8iOdnLBWtO

I am proud to announce the House has passed legislation I cosponsored to award the Congressional Gold Medal to the 13 U.S. servicemembers who lost their lives in August during the evacuation from Afghanistan. https://t.co/g86cPvcFMS
I’m hosting a Telephone Town Hall on Friday, October 29th at 11:00am to help seniors navigate the ongoing Medicare Open Enrollment Period. https://t.co/6NjZ2XBAOx
Great to be on @BridgeStreetTV this morning! We talked about football & hockey, fall activities in Central New York, and my dog Henry’s love for puppuccinos and pumpkins. https://t.co/Oiw3T9yC1q

With the @ProbSolveCaucus , I called on Congress to fully fund the CHIPS for America Act. Funding this bill would help secure the U.S. supply chain and has the potential to jumpstart semiconductor manufacturing in CNY and nationwide. 
https://t.co/hsk3mYMQ16
https://t.co/yHlHaTz1iz

For three decades, @sosbones has been a trusted provider of orthopedic care in CNY. I enjoyed meeting with the dedicated healthcare professionals at SOS and Emma, the office’s service dog and most enthusiastic patient greeter! https://t.co/u1hcKJmRQW
ICYMI: I joined @TeamCavuto to discuss the serious national security implications of the supply chain crisis. https://t.co/mG5HPr0UAM

Today, I announced Oswego County Opportunities has received $200,000 in federal funds to expand programs that provide emergency shelter, food, clothing, and counseling to homeless and runaway children. https://t.co/q5Y61LvS7B

I am proud to announce over $350K in federal funding from the Great Lakes Restoration Initiative (GLRI) is coming to Central New York to support water quality and conservation projects that help protect access to clean drinking water. https://t.co/F9iErzgbmK

After urging the Biden Administration to normalize travel along the US-Canada border, I’m glad to see it will now reopen to our vaccinated neighbors in Canada. This is an important and overdue step. https://t.co/91w2NhoP2m

I was featured on Fox & Friends highlighting the national security implications of our supply chain crisis. Instead of being reliant on adversaries like China for critical goods, the Biden Administration needs to take proactive steps to strengthen American manufacturing. https://t.co/UuS0wQFi9I

Today is the last day to participate in the I-81 public comment period. I encourage all Central New Yorkers to seize this opportunity to make their voices heard!
https://t.co/7y47O7RdRS

October is Breast Cancer Awareness Month. While we have made progress to promote early detection and expand medical research, there’s so much more to be done to support the courageous women and men diagnosed with breast cancer. https://t.co/DrBwzWsea1
I was proud to be at Columbus Circle to recognize the contributions of our Italian community here in Central New York. https://t.co/LtBP6JD5kZ

.@ComeAndSeeCuse is a faith-based organization that provides programming to support individuals in Syracuse. To raise awareness for Brady Faith Center, their staff biked 485 miles from Syracuse to the U.S. Capitol Building. I was glad to greet them at their final destination. https://t.co/2c40W2UmmA

I’m pleased the President has heeded our call to approve a Major Disaster Declaration for Cayuga County and other local communities impacted by Tropical Storm Fred. My full statement:
https://t.co/r09FJbb5af
Fulton manufacturers like @HuhtamakiGroup, Universal Metal, N.E.T., and Die Inc., provide good-paying local jobs and are critical economic drivers for our Central New York region.
In honor of Manufacturing Month, the City of Fulton held an event to showcase their thriving manufacturing industry. https://t.co/vVJxuygl2h
I’m proud to announce over $300,000 in DOJ funding will be delivered to the @SyracusePolice to expand community policing and crisis intervention initiatives. https://t.co/DKTMxBoEdh

I had the pleasure of working alongside Carla while leading the Organized Crime Unit for the Northern District of New York. She has a superb work ethic, unwavering commitment to justice, and is exactly the type of leader this office needs.
Congratulations to Carla Freedman on her historic confirmation as U.S. Attorney for the Northern District of New York, becoming the first woman to serve in this role. https://t.co/AYbyj7909b

Since 2015, the @IVMFSyracuseU’s Onward to Opportunity program has helped military families transitioning to civilian life find jobs that meet their interests and skillset. I’m proud my bill will expand the reach of this program. https://t.co/5sQ7MtppnQ

Tonight at 6:30pm, there will be a virtual hearing for the National Park Service’s Fort Ontario Study. During the hearing, Central New Yorkers will have the opportunity to weigh in on the prospect of Fort Ontario becoming a National Park. More information: https://t.co/3Nj6ht1ai6 https://t.co/WbzGqnszBw

I delivered the keynote address at the CNY Association of Chiefs of Police Awards ceremony. In Congress, I’m proud to support our law enforcement community and have led efforts to push back against Albany’s dangerous bail reform law and radical calls to defund the police. https://t.co/XckfAbfYKy

To prevent future cyberattacks from compromising our nation’s critical assets, I introduced the Securing Systemically Important Critical Infrastructure Act. This bill prioritizes federal cybersecurity services for our critical infrastructure systems. https://t.co/knQCBYxPYL

I joined the Solvay VFW to celebrate Manuel Martinez’s 100th and presented him with a Congressional Certificate as well as a flag flown over the U.S. Capitol to celebrate. Manny is a proud WWII veteran and former Geddes Supervisor. Happy Birthday Manny! https://t.co/mOb2mh4jdy

I was at @IVMFSyracuseU to announce the passage of my bill, the Onward to Opportunity Act. This legislation creates a pilot program in the @DeptofDefense that enables the IVMF to expand their successful workforce development program for military families https://t.co/gWrucQuxrc

I’m pleased to announce @farnhamservices  has received $125,000 in federal funds through the @CDCgov's Drug Free Communities (DFC) program to prevent and address youth substance use disorder in Oswego.  https://t.co/a77roOw3O9

Despite a record number of illegal crossings on the southern border and an influx in drug smuggling, the Biden Administration announced its intention to end the ‘Remain in Mexico’ policy. I joined @FoxBusiness to discuss this reckless decision. https://t.co/7G6o9aVJnd

I’ve been an advocate for animal welfare and a leader on efforts to end horse slaughter and protect animals victimized by fighting rings. For this work, I am honored to be named a 2020 Legislative Hero by the @HSLegFund. #HumaneAwards https://t.co/ge5VAAUN3o

WATCH: I spoke on the House Floor in support of the bipartisan Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act and urged Speaker Pelosi to hold a vote on this measure today. This critical bill delivers comprehensive investments for our nation’s physical infrastructure systems https://t.co/K9WUPl3ewj
September is National Recovery Month. I was proud to join my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to recognize those working to overcome addiction. #CongressGoesPurple https://t.co/hDEjjEoDH1

I am glad to announce $5 million in funding from the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (@SAMHSA) will be delivered to @LibertyResourc1 in Syracuse to strengthen its school-based mental health programming. https://t.co/oYlMufOYQB

Together with @gillibrandny, @RepStefanik, and @RepTenney, tonight at 7pm, I’m hosting a virtual Service Academy Night. Representatives from our nation’s service academies will provide students, parents, & school officials with info on the service academy application process. https://t.co/gFnaBJalVk

Bob Gang was honored at this year’s @SUCollegeofLaw alumni weekend. Bob is a WWII & Korean War veteran, a graduate of Syracuse Law’s Class of 1942, and the college’s oldest living alumnus! I was proud to present him with a Congressional Certificate honoring his life and career. https://t.co/4Ph2xQEWsj

Critically for Central New York, the bills I authored will combat Lyme disease, eliminate workforce barriers for new Americans, address cases of sexual harassment in public housing, and expand workforce development services for servicemembers, veterans, and their spouses.

I’m pleased to announce the National Defense Authorization Act passed in the House last night and included nine bills I authored as well federal funding to support our local workforce. https://t.co/iIwhJEvaz2
With the humanitarian and security crisis at the southern border worsening, I spoke on the House Floor to urge passage of my bill, the Border Security for America Act. https://t.co/wwGFSwWUQK
